answers.answer: Hi,One differential could be furuncles or boils which are deep infection of hair follicles. Boils present as one or more tender red spots, lumps or pustules. Large boils form abscesses, defined as an accumulation of pus within a cavity. Most people with boils are otherwise healthy but it is sometimes related to immune deficiency, anemia, diabetes or iron deficiency. Cleansing regimen and topical antiseptic or antibiotics may be applied to the lesion. It is also important to wash your hands regularly. If the boils fail to clear up, a swab should be taken for microbiological culture to rule out any resistant strain of bacteria. If it persists, have this checked by your doctor for proper diagnosis and management.Take care and keep us posted.

question: I often wake up in the mornings to find random red painful bumps, mostly on my chest or abdomen.  They look as if they could be bug bites.  They stay for a really long time and are usually very sore and eventually break open.  I believe them to be infected.  I have made it a weekly routine to wash my bed linens and I have even taken steps to make sure that I am not sleeping without clothing on, yet still the problem persists.  Any suggestions or possible diagnosis for this problem?!
title: Random bumps
